parse_markers.notice: Argument $response is missing from the function Docblock
Argument $params is missing from the function Docblock

docblock.description: A page controller.
docblock.long-description:
public function actionBrowse() { // blah blah blah

     // now set the view
     $this->response->view = array(
         'text/html' => 'index',
         // closure always takes one param, the response transfer object
         'application/json' => function($response) {
             $response->layout = null;
             return json_encode($response->view_data->list);
         },
         'application/xml' => 'default.xml',
     );
 }

docblock.description: The action to perform, typically discovered from the params.
The context of the request environment.
Collection point for data, typically for rendering the page.
The page format to render, typically discovered from the params.
Path-info parameters, typically from the route.
A data transfer object for the eventual HTTP response.
Constructor.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The request environment.

docblock.description: Returns the action, typically discovered from the params.
Returns the Context object.
Returns the data collection object.
Returns the page format, typically discovered from the params.
Returns the params.
Returns the Response object.
Executes the action and pre/post hooks:
docblock.long-description:
• calls preExec()

  • calls preAction()

  • calls action() to find and invoke the action method

  • calls postAction()

  • calls preRender()

  • calls render() to execute the RenderHandler for this page

  • calls postRender()

  • calls postExec() and then returns the Response object

docblock.description: Runs at the beginning of `exec()` before `preAction()`.
Runs after `preExec()` and before `action()`.
Determines the action method, then invokes it.
Invokes a method by name, matching method params to `$this->params`.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method name to execute, typcially an action.

docblock.description: Runs after `action()` and before `preRender()`.
Runs after `postAction()` and before `render()`.
Renders the page into the response object.
Runs after `render()` and before `postExec()`.
Runs at the end of `exec()` after `postRender()`.

docblock.description: Retrieves an **unfiltered** value from a user input.
docblock.long-description:
A value by key from the $post and $files properties, or an alternate default value if that key does not exist in either location. Files takes precedence over post.

If the key is null and the content type isn't multipart/form-data and $post and $files are empty, the raw data from the request body is returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The $post and $files key to retrieve the value of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to return if the key does not exist in either $post or $files.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of $post[$key] combined with $files[$key], or the raw request body, or the alternate default value.

docblock.description: Retrieves an **unfiltered** value by key from the `$header` property, or an alternate default value if that key does not exist.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The $http key to retrieve the value of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to return if the key does not exist.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of $header[$key], or the alternate default value.

docblock.description: Parse an HTTP `Accept*` header and sort by the quality factor, the highest being first in the returned array. The returned data is unfiltered.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the accept header to parse.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to return if the key does not exist.

docblock.description: Gets an `Accept` header. If you want the content-type, ask for `'type'`; otherwise, if you want (e.g.) `'Accept-Language'`, ask for `'language'`.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The `$accept` key to return; if null, returns the entire `$accept` property.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to return if the key does not exist.

docblock.description: Set the "fake" `$header` property.

tag.description: The alternative default value to return if the requested key does not exist.

tag.description: The requested value, or the alternative default value.

docblock.description: Retains information about the controller results for transfer to an actual HTTP response object.
Should the response disable browser caching?
docblock.long-description:
When false, the getHeaders() method will set these headers in its return value (note that they are not added to $headers directly):

{{code: Pragma: no-cache Cache-Control: no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate Cache-Control: post-check=0, pre-check=0 Expires: 1 }}

When true or null, the getHeaders() method will make no changes to the existing headers.

docblock.description: The response body content.
The Content-Type of the response.
The response cookies.
Whether or not cookies should default to being sent by HTTP only.
The response headers (less the cookies).
Redirect to this location.
The response status code.
The response status text.
The HTTP version to send as.
Should the response disable HTTP caching?
docblock.long-description:
When false, the getHeaders() method will add these headers:

Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate
Cache-Control: post-check=0, pre-check=0
Expires: 1

tag.name: param
tag.description: When true, disable browser caching.

docblock.description: Is caching turned off?

tag.name: return
tag.description: Note that this is a ternary: true, false, or null.

tag.description: The path on the server in which the cookie will be available on.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The domain that the cookie is available on.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Indicates that the cookie should only be transmitted over a secure HTTPS connection.

tag.name: param
tag.description: When true, the cookie will be made accessible only through the HTTP protocol. This means that the cookie won't be accessible by scripting languages, such as JavaScript.

docblock.description: By default, should cookies be sent by HTTP only?

tag.name: param
tag.description: True to send by HTTP only, false to send by any method.

docblock.description: Set a location that the response should redirect to, along with a a status code and status text.

tag.description: The HTTP status text; default is `'See Other'`.
